name: White‑tailed Deer
description: A medium deer with tan coat and a white flagging tail; slim legs and alert ears beneath broadleaf canopy.

name: Red Deer
description: A large, russet‑brown stag with branching antlers, moving in small herds among tall trunks.

name: Wild Boar
description: A low, barrel‑bodied pig with coarse dark bristles and curved tusks, rooting through leaf litter.

name: European Hare
description: A long‑limbed hare with mottled brown fur and tall black‑tipped ears, poised on forest edge paths.

name: Cottontail Rabbit
description: A small rabbit with gray‑brown coat and a puff of white tail, flicking through underbrush.

name: Gray Squirrel
description: A nimble tree‑squirrel with slate‑gray coat and plumed tail, leaping between low branches.

name: Red Fox
description: A slender canid with rust‑red coat, white throat, and black stockings; a brush tail tipped in white.

name: Wild Turkey
description: A broad‑breasted ground bird with bronze iridescent feathers and a fanned tail.

name: Common Pheasant
description: A long‑tailed gamebird; cocks wear emerald heads and barred bronze bodies.

name: Ruffed Grouse
description: A mottled brown grouse with a short crest; bursts from leaf litter in a whir of wings.

name: Black Bear
description: A thick‑set bear with glossy black coat and small ears, foraging along berry thickets.

name: Gray Wolf
description: A rangy wolf with grizzled coat and keen amber eyes, padding along game trails.

name: Bison
description: A massive, dark‑brown bovine with shaggy forequarters and a humped shoulder.

name: Pronghorn
description: A tan‑and‑white fleet ungulate with black cheek bars and short pronged horns.

name: Wild Horse
description: A muscular, dun‑coated horse with dark mane and tail, grazing in open steppe.

name: Coyote
description: A lean canid with tawny‑gray coat and narrow muzzle, trotting with tail low across grasslands.

name: Black‑tailed Jackrabbit
description: A long‑eared hare with dark tail and sandy coat, sprinting in zigzags across open ground.

name: Greater Prairie‑Chicken
description: A stout, barred grouse with rounded tail and orange air sacs on the neck.

name: Northern Bobwhite Quail
description: A small, round quail with short tail and crisp facial stripe; coveys burst from cover.

name: Canada Goose
description: A large goose with black head and white chinstrap, grazing stubble fields.

name: Mallard Duck
description: A medium duck; drakes with green heads and curled tail feathers, dabbling in ponds.

name: Sandhill Crane
description: A tall, gray crane with crimson crown, striding through wide marshy flats.

name: Mountain Goat
description: A stocky goat with shaggy white coat and black horns, clinging to near‑vertical crags.

name: Bighorn Sheep
description: A heavy sheep with massive curled horns and brown coat, moving along ledges.

name: Alpine Ibex
description: A thick‑set wild goat with long scimitar horns and chocolate coat mottled with gray.

name: Chamois
description: A sleek, tan‑brown antelope‑goat with contrasting face mask and hooked horns.

name: Alpine Marmot
description: A stout, low rodent with thick brown fur and blunt nose, whistling from burrow lips.

name: Snowshoe Hare
description: A compact hare with seasonally pale coat and oversized hind feet for snow.

name: Rock Ptarmigan
description: A plump grouse turning white in winter; mottled brown in summer among rocks.

name: Willow Ptarmigan
description: A red‑brown grouse that whitens in winter, sheltering in dwarf willows.

name: Himalayan Tahr
description: A long‑haired wild goat with dark mane draping the shoulders.

name: Blue Sheep (Bharal)
description: A slate‑gray wild sheep with pale saddle and sweeping horns.

name: Alligator
description: A broad‑snouted reptile armored in dark scales, drifting in still backwaters.

name: Snapping Turtle
description: A heavy, ridged‑shelled turtle with powerful beak and long tail, resting in murk.

name: Beaver
description: A stout, brown mammal with blunt muzzle and broad flat tail; lodges rim quiet channels.

name: Muskrat
description: A small, glossy‑brown rodent with laterally flattened tail, weaving bank burrows.

name: Nutria
description: A large, orange‑toothed rodent with shaggy brown coat and long round tail.

name: Feral Hog
description: A bristled, dark‑coated pig with low shoulders and slashing tusks, wallowing in mud.

name: Great Blue Heron
description: A tall, blue‑gray heron with dagger bill and slow, deliberate wingbeats.

name: Mottled Duck
description: A mottled brown duck with pale face and bright orange legs, dabbling in marsh shallows.

name: Crawfish
description: A small, brown‑green crustacean with raised claws and segmented tail, backing under roots.

name: King Rail
description: A slender rail with rich rufous body and long bill, slipping through reed beds.

name: Dromedary Camel
description: A tall camel with a single high hump and sandy coat; long lashes shade calm eyes.

name: Arabian Oryx
description: A pale antelope with long, straight black‑tipped horns and dark mask.

name: Addax
description: A spiral‑horned antelope with pale sandy coat and splayed hooves for dunes.

name: Fennec Fox
description: A small fox with enormous ears and pale sandy fur, bounding between shrubs.

name: Desert Hare
description: A light, long‑eared hare with sandy coat and dark ear tips, crouched by shrubs.

name: Sandgrouse
description: A compact, swift bird with cryptic barred plumage and narrow tail.

name: Desert Monitor Lizard
description: A heavy, tan lizard with beadlike scales and low swaggering gait.

name: Rattlesnake
description: A thick, diamond‑patterned viper with a keratin rattle at the tail tip.

name: Jerboa
description: A tiny, long‑tailed rodent with elongated hind legs and tufted tail tip.

name: Houbara Bustard
description: A tall, sandy bird with wispy neck plumes; wary in open flats.

name: Harbor Seal
description: A sleek, spotted gray seal with large dark eyes, hauled out on kelp‑strewn rocks.

name: California Sea Lion
description: A robust sea lion with dog‑like head and chocolate coat, barking on jetties.

name: Common Eider
description: A large sea duck; drakes with black‑and‑white pattern and sloping green nape.

name: Cormorant
description: A dark, long‑necked seabird with hooked bill, holding wings out to dry on pilings.

name: Herring Gull
description: A pale gray‑backed gull with yellow bill and pink legs, milling along surf lines.

name: Blue Crab
description: A broad, blue‑green crab with spined shell and paddle‑shaped rear legs.

name: Shallow Lobster
description: A heavy, dark lobster with large asymmetrical claws and ridged carapace.

name: Atlantic Mackerel
description: A sleek, iridescent fish with wavy dark bars along the back.

name: Atlantic Herring
description: A silver‑sided fish flashing in tight schools just off shore.

name: Chinook Salmon
description: A large, powerful salmon with bluish back and silver sides, staging near river mouths.

name: Cave Bat
description: A small, soot‑brown bat clustering in ceiling roosts; fine fur and delicate wings.

name: Greater Cave Bat
description: A larger, long‑eared bat with dusk‑gray fur and broad wings, circling slow pools.

name: Blind Cave Fish
description: A pale, eyeless fish with smooth scales and faintly pink fins.

name: Cave Crayfish
description: A colorless crayfish with elongated antennae and narrow claws, lurking under stones.

name: Olm (Cave Salamander)
description: A slender, pallid salamander with frilled external gills and tiny limbs.

name: Cave Beetle
description: A matte‑black beetle with thick carapace and slow, deliberate gait.

name: Cave Rat
description: A lean, long‑whiskered rat with pale gray coat and large eyes adapted to dim light.

name: Cave Newt
description: A smooth‑skinned, pale newt with wide tail and delicate toes, gliding in pools.

name: Raccoon
description: A stout, ring‑tailed scavenger with gray coat and black mask, padding along creek banks.

name: European Badger
description: A low, broad mustelid with silver‑gray back and bold black‑and‑white facial stripes.

name: Pine Marten
description: A slender tree‑hunter with rich chestnut coat and creamy throat patch, flowing over branches.

name: Porcupine
description: A round‑bodied rodent cloaked in quills over a dark undercoat, waddling between trees.

name: Hedgehog
description: A small, brown insect‑eater curled under a mantle of short spines.

name: Wood Pigeon
description: A plump, blue‑gray pigeon with white neck crescent and pinkish breast.

name: Woodcock
description: A short‑billed, leaf‑brown wader ghosting through dusk beneath low boughs.

name: European Robin
description: A tiny, round bird with brick‑red face and breast, flicking through brambles.

name: Song Thrush
description: A speckled, warm‑brown thrush with clear, ringing calls from shaded perches.

name: Red Squirrel
description: A russet tree‑squirrel with tufted ears and airy tail, leaping needle‑to‑needle.

name: Dormouse
description: A golden‑brown mouse with large dark eyes and a feathery tail, curled in nests of leaves.

name: Ring‑necked Dove
description: A soft gray dove with black collar and pink legs, cooing from hedgerows.

name: European Polecat
description: A dark, bandit‑masked mustelid slipping along woodland verges.

name: Grey Partridge
description: A round, earth‑toned partridge shuffling through stubble and edge scrub.

name: Pika (Forest Edge)
description: A tiny, round‑eared lagomorph squeaking from rock piles at treeline.

name: Pika
description: A pebble‑colored, short‑eared lagomorph squeaking from boulder crevices.

name: Rock Hyrax
description: A squat, short‑tailed browser sunning on warm stone shelves.

name: Chukar Partridge
description: A barred, sand‑gray partridge with bold black eye stripe on scree slopes.

name: Snow Partridge
description: A chunky, gray‑brown partridge mottled for alpine rubble.

name: Dusky Grouse
description: A heavy, slate‑brown grouse booming from conifers at timberline.

name: Alpine Snow Hare
description: A hare turning white in winter, crouched among wind‑scoured hummocks.

name: Ptarmigan (Rock)
description: A compact grouse that molts to white in winter; speckled brown in summer.

name: Mountain Quail
description: A round quail with bold flank bars and a straight head plume, skittering uphill.

name: Hoary Marmot
description: A large, silver‑tipped marmot whistling from burrow lips on talus fans.

name: Blue Grouse
description: A dark forest‑edge grouse fanning tail and neck tufts in display.

name: Groundhog
description: A burly, brown marmot with blunt nose and short tail, grazing along burrow mounds.

name: Prairie Dog
description: A small, tan ground squirrel that chirps and pops in bustling colonies.

name: Striped Skunk
description: A glossy black mustelid with bold white stripes and plume tail, ambling at dusk.

name: Large Badger
description: A flat‑bodied digger with white facial stripe and massive foreclaws.

name: Jackdaw (Field)
description: A small black corvid with pale eyes, striding through short turf.

name: Lesser Prairie‑Chicken
description: A barred brown grouse with short tail and muted neck sacs.

name: Sage Grouse
description: A large, gray grouse with spiky tail and white breast bib, booming on leks.

name: Field Hare
description: A long‑eared brown hare crouched among tufted grasses.

name: Common Crane (Steppe)
description: A tall, gray crane with drooping feather plumes at the tail.

name: Saiga Antelope
description: A pale, long‑nosed antelope moving in loose steppe herds.

name: Bullfrog
description: A large, olive frog with broad mouth and powerful hind legs, plopping from banks.

name: Green Treefrog
description: A small, bright‑green frog clinging to reeds above still water.

name: Softshell Turtle
description: A flat, leathery‑backed turtle with snorkel snout buried in sand.

name: Common Moorhen
description: A dark waterbird with red frontal shield and yellow bill tip, threading lily pads.

name: Coot
description: A slate‑gray waterbird with white bill and lobed toes, pattering across water.

name: Snipe
description: A long‑billed, cryptic wader zig‑zagging over soggy meadows at dusk.

name: Tilapia (Wild)
description: A broad, olive fish with vertical bars moving in warm shallows.

name: Channel Catfish
description: A long, whiskered fish with smooth skin and forked tail cruising muddy channels.

name: Common Carp
description: A deep‑bodied, bronze fish with down‑turned mouth sifting silt.

name: Softshell Crab (Marsh)
description: A molting crab with tender new carapace hiding among cordgrass.

name: Dorcas Gazelle
description: A dainty, tan gazelle with slender black‑tipped horns and white rump patch.

name: Arabian Hare
description: A sandy‑brown hare with long black‑tipped ears, crouched by scrub.

name: Desert Hedgehog
description: A tiny hedgehog with pale spines and dark mask, nosing among stones.

name: Cape Hare
description: A long‑limbed hare with tawny coat and white eye ring, sprinting over flats.

name: Uromastyx (Spiny‑tailed Lizard)
description: A broad, herbivorous lizard with heavy, spiked tail and beaded scales.

name: Sandfish Skink
description: A small, smooth‑scaled lizard that swims through loose dunes.

name: Desert Tortoise
description: A domed, tan tortoise with sturdy scaled legs and beaked mouth.

name: Fat‑tailed Gecko
description: A squat, banded gecko with thick, fat‑storing tail.

name: Sand Partridge
description: A compact, sandy partridge with neat chest bars and swift whirr of wings.

name: Crowned Sandgrouse
description: A small, swift sandgrouse with neat cap and long pointed wings.

name: Atlantic Cod
description: A thick‑bodied, olive‑brown fish with pale lateral line and chin barbel.

name: Haddock
description: A silver fish with black lateral blotch and dark dorsal line, schooling over banks.

name: Atlantic Pollock
description: A sleek, green‑gray fish with sharp fin line and pale sides.

name: European Sea Bass
description: A long, silver predator gliding over reefs and jetties.

name: Mullet
description: A blunt‑nosed, silver fish tailing in surf channels and estuaries.

name: Flounder
description: A flatfish mottled like sand, both eyes riding one side.

name: Sardine
description: A small, bright‑silver fish flashing through tight shoals.

name: Anchovy
description: A tiny, slender fish with gaping mouth and glassy sides.

name: Puffin
description: A stocky seabird with gaudy bill plates and whirring wings over swell.

name: Guillemot
description: A black‑and‑white auk with dagger bill, standing upright on ledges.

name: Razorshell Clam
description: A long, narrow bivalve like a polished handle, anchored in wet sand.

name: Cockle
description: A ridged, heart‑shaped bivalve tucked beneath tidal flats.

name: Periwinkle Snail
description: A small, spiraled shore snail grazing dark weeded stones.

name: Octopus
description: A mottled, soft‑bodied cephalopod with watchful eyes and coiling arms.

name: Squid
description: A sleek, torpedo‑shaped cephalopod with fin skirt and quick color shifts.

name: Sea Otter
description: A dense‑furred mustelid floating belly‑up, rolling in kelp beds.

name: Cave Cricket
description: A long‑legged, pale cricket with arched back and feathery antennae.

name: Cave Woodlouse
description: A flattened, colorless isopod trundling over damp stone.

name: Blind Cave Shrimp
description: A translucent shrimp with elongated feelers, drifting in black pools.

name: Troglobite Spider
description: A pallid, long‑legged spider with elongated pedipalps, clinging to walls.

name: Cave Snail
description: A tiny, glass‑shelled snail sliding along mineral crust.

name: Blink Dog
description: A rangy hound with sleek, fawn coat that shimmers at the edges as if out of step with the world.

name: Giant Fire Beetle
description: A fist‑sized beetle with glowing thoracic glands, wings ticking softly.

name: Phase Hare
description: A silver‑gray hare whose outline wavers in heat‑shimmer as it bounds.

name: Mossback Tortoise
description: A low, domed tortoise with shell tufted in soft green moss.

name: Glow Toad
description: A squat, olive toad with faint bioluminescent freckles along the flanks.

name: Silver Quill Pheasant
description: A trim pheasant with mirrored feather tips that glitter in slant light.

name: Drift Otter
description: A sleek, pale otter with webbed hind feet and a kelp‑green sheen to the pelt.

name: Sand‑skink (Glider)
description: A tiny lizard that 'swims' through dunes leaving no surface trace.

name: Lantern Moth
description: A broad‑winged moth whose abdomen glows like a banked ember.

name: Stone Finch
description: A speckled, rock‑colored finch that nests in shallow cracks and hops among scree.

name: Whisper Bat
description: A soft‑furred bat whose wing membranes blur at the edges in flight.

name: Pearl Crab
description: A pale shore crab with opalescent carapace that mirrors the sky.
